title: quiz-03-geometry
author: Phoenix Admission Care
questions: What will be the ratio of circumference and diameter of a circle?
The height of a cylinder is 10cm and radius = 10π. The cylinder will contain how many liters of water?
What is the half of the complementary angle of 560?
If the diameter of a wheel = 10cm, what will be the distance crossed by the wheel after 10 rotation?
The largest chord of a circle = 10m, what will be the area of the circle?
If the volume of a cube = 27 units then which one of the following is the diagonal of the cube?
If the diameter of a cone = 10 cm and height = 12 cm, what will be the length of slant height?
There is a circular garden with a diameter of 30m. Inside of the circle there is a grass road with 4m width around the garden. What is the area of the road?
\text{There is a square-shaped field whose area is 121 $m^2$.There is a rectangle shaped road along the diagonal of the field. If the breadth of the road is 2 m what is the area of the road?}
The base of a right-angle triangle = y and perpendicular= y. Which one of the following ratios indicates the triangle?
